title: Zero-Shot Disease Prediction via Drug Properties
summary: Limited impact ceiling makes zero-shot low ROI
key_findings: ~42% of test diseases have 0% kNN coverage (consistent across seeds)
BUT these diseases only contain ~15% of GT pairs (avg 1.6 drugs/disease)
Non-zero diseases: avg 9.9 drugs/disease (6x more GT pairs)
Impact ceiling: 10% zero-shot recall adds only +1.5 pp to overall R@30

k_nearest_selection_failures.description: GT drugs exist in training but k=20 fails to find right neighbors

truly_novel_drugs.description: GT drugs not in any training disease GT

recommendation: Deprioritize zero-shot approaches; focus on improving kNN for the 85% of GT pairs with coverage
